channel.title: Boston Women in Bioinformatics's Events
channel.description: Stay updated with our upcoming events and meetups

item.title: Automating the "Second Job" of Job Searching with JustAJob
item.description:
When: Thursday, November 6, 2025 at 11:30 AM

Where: Zoom Online Event

Tired of manually tracking job applications in sprawsheets? Join BWIB for an interactive conversation with [Lianna Novitz](https://www.linkedin.com/in/liannanovitz/), creator of [JustAJobApp](https://www.justajob.app/) â€” an [open-source](https://github.com/just-a-job-app/jobseeker-analytics) app that connects to your inbox to automatically build your job search dashboard. **â€‹What You'll Learn**: - â€‹How JustAJobApp eliminates manual data entry and keeps you organized during your job search - â€‹Live demo of the app in action - â€‹The story behind building an open-source solution to job search burnout - â€‹Where the app is headed next (including an exciting Crowdfunding Campaign!) - â€‹How it compares to other job search tools like Teal - â€‹And a little bit about Lianna, who started out in neuroscience, then pivoted to software engineering, and recently navigated her own job search (complete with graphs and all! ğŸ“Š) **â€‹Why Attend**: With 64% of job seekers experiencing burnout and applications per hire tripling since 2021, the job search process has become a full-time job itself. Discover how automation can help you focus on what matters â€” landing your next role â€” instead of managing spreadsheets. **â€‹What to Expect**: âœ¨ 20-minute deep dive and demo of JustAJobApp ğŸ’¡ Insights on data science meets biotech business ğŸ™‹ Live Q&A with Lianna ğŸ Raffle for a Starbucks gift card (for attendees who share feedback) â€‹Whether you're actively job searching or interested in the intersection of productivity tools and career development, this session will leave you with actionable insights and tools to streamline your search. **â€‹No more spreadsheets. No more manual tracking. Just a better way to job search.**

item.title: Byte and Bite: Bioinformatics Lunch Meetup
item.description:
When: Friday, November 7, 2025 at 12:00 PM

Where: CanalSide Food & Drink, CambridgeSide, 100 Cambridgeside Pl, Cambridge, Massachusetts

Are you a bioinformatics enthusiast looking to meet and mingle with fellow professionals in a relaxed and unscripted environment? Join us for a Bioinformatics Networking Lunch, an informal gathering where great conversations, shared ideas, and new connections are on the menu! ### What to Know Before You Register - This gathering is intended for individuals who identify as [women](https://www.thetrevorproject.org/resources/category/gender-identity/). ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ”¬ - Each guest will be responsible for purchasing their own meal and/or beverages. ğŸ½ï¸ ### How to find us Weâ€™ll be gathering at the CambridgeSide Mall food court, a lively and accessible spot right in the heart of East Cambridge. If you're taking the MBTA Green Line, hop off at Lechmere Stationâ€”itâ€™s just a short walk to the mall entrance. Driving in? The mall offers plenty of garage parking with flexible hourly rates and extended hours, so youâ€™ll have no trouble finding a spot. â€‹Once inside, head toward Chilacatesâ€”weâ€™ll be nearby! The food court features a variety of [dining options](https://www.cambridgeside.com/event/canalside-food-drink/2145582916), so feel free to grab a bite, explore, and settle in.

item.title: GitHub Basics 2
item.description:
When: Thursday, November 13, 2025 at 5:30 PM

Where: Boynton Yards, Somerville, MA

Ready to level up your GitHub skills? GitHub Basics 2 builds on the foundations from our first session and dives deeper into collaborative coding skills like: - Branching and pull requests - Resolving merge conflicts - Using issues and discussions to communicate code changes This is a hands-on, beginner-friendly workshop designed to help you gain confidence with GitHub workflows, whether youâ€™re contributing to open source, managing your own projects, or collaborating with a team. A basic understanding of making commits and working with remotes is required. If you didn't attend our first GitHub basics workshop, please review the material for making commits [here](https://github.com/sstein93/git-github-workshop/blob/main/02_git_basics.md) and working with remotes [here](https://github.com/sstein93/git-github-workshop/blob/main/03_git_github.md). **Parking is $10 at Boynton yards if you park after 5pm, and there may be street parking on Cambridge street or other nearby streets**
